00022 /*
00023  * Range lock is used to allow multiple threads writing a single shared
00024  * file given each thread is writing to a non-overlapping portion of the
00025  * file.
00026  *
00027  * Refer to the possible upstream kernel version of range lock by
00028  * Jan Kara <jack@suse.cz>: https://lkml.org/lkml/2013/1/31/480
00029  *
00030  * This file could later replaced by the upstream kernel version.
00031  */
00032 /*
00033  * Author: Prakash Surya <surya1@llnl.gov>
00034  * Author: Bobi Jam <bobijam.xu@intel.com>
00035  */
00036 #include "range_lock.h"
00037 #include <lustre/lustre_user.h>
00038 
00047 void range_lock_tree_init(struct range_lock_tree *tree)
00048 {
00049         tree->rlt_root = NULL;
00050         tree->rlt_sequence = 0;
00051         spin_lock_init(&tree->rlt_lock);
00052 }
00053 
00064 void range_lock_init(struct range_lock *lock, __u64 start, __u64 end)
00065 {
00066         interval_init(&lock->rl_node);
00067         if (end != LUSTRE_EOF)
00068                 end >>= PAGE_SHIFT;
00069         interval_set(&lock->rl_node, start >> PAGE_SHIFT, end);
00070         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lock->rl_next_lock);
00071         lock->rl_task = NULL;
00072         lock->rl_lock_count = 0;
00073         lock->rl_blocking_ranges = 0;
00074         lock->rl_sequence = 0;
00075 }
00076 
00077 static inline struct range_lock *next_lock(struct range_lock *lock)
00078 {
00079         return list_entry(lock->rl_next_lock.next, typeof(*lock), rl_next_lock);
00080 }
00081 
00093 static enum interval_iter range_unlock_cb(struct interval_node *node, void *arg)
00094 {
00095         struct range_lock *lock = arg;
00096         struct range_lock *overlap = node2rangelock(node);
00097         struct range_lock *iter;
00098         ENTRY;
00099 
00100         list_for_each_entry(iter, &overlap->rl_next_lock, rl_next_lock) {
00101                 if (iter->rl_sequence > lock->rl_sequence) {
00102                         --iter->rl_blocking_ranges;
00103                         LASSERT(iter->rl_blocking_ranges > 0);
00104                 }
00105         }
00106         if (overlap->rl_sequence > lock->rl_sequence) {
00107                 --overlap->rl_blocking_ranges;
00108                 if (overlap->rl_blocking_ranges == 0)
00109                         wake_up_process(overlap->rl_task);
00110         }
00111         RETURN(INTERVAL_ITER_CONT);
00112 }
00113 
00124 void range_unlock(struct range_lock_tree *tree, struct range_lock *lock)
00125 {
00126         ENTRY;
00127 
00128         spin_lock(&tree->rlt_lock);
00129         if (!list_empty(&lock->rl_next_lock)) {
00130                 struct range_lock *next;
00131 
00132                 if (interval_is_intree(&lock->rl_node)) { /* first lock */
00133                         /* Insert the next same range lock into the tree */
00134                         next = next_lock(lock);
00135                         next->rl_lock_count = lock->rl_lock_count - 1;
00136                         interval_erase(&lock->rl_node, &tree->rlt_root);
00137                         interval_insert(&next->rl_node, &tree->rlt_root);
00138                 } else {
00139                         /* find the first lock in tree */
00140                         list_for_each_entry(next, &lock->rl_next_lock,
00141                                             rl_next_lock) {
00142                                 if (!interval_is_intree(&next->rl_node))
00143                                         continue;
00144 
00145                                 LASSERT(next->rl_lock_count > 0);
00146                                 next->rl_lock_count--;
00147                                 break;
00148                         }
00149                 }
00150                 list_del_init(&lock->rl_next_lock);
00151         } else {
00152                 LASSERT(interval_is_intree(&lock->rl_node));
00153                 interval_erase(&lock->rl_node, &tree->rlt_root);
00154         }
00155 
00156         interval_search(tree->rlt_root, &lock->rl_node.in_extent,
00157                         range_unlock_cb, lock);
00158         spin_unlock(&tree->rlt_lock);
00159 
00160         EXIT;
00161 }
00162 
00174 static enum interval_iter range_lock_cb(struct interval_node *node, void *arg)
00175 {
00176         struct range_lock *lock = (struct range_lock *)arg;
00177         struct range_lock *overlap = node2rangelock(node);
00178 
00179         lock->rl_blocking_ranges += overlap->rl_lock_count + 1;
00180         RETURN(INTERVAL_ITER_CONT);
00181 }
00182 
00196 int range_lock(struct range_lock_tree *tree, struct range_lock *lock)
00197 {
00198         struct interval_node *node;
00199         int rc = 0;
00200         ENTRY;
00201 
00202         spin_lock(&tree->rlt_lock);
00203         /*
00204          * We need to check for all conflicting intervals
00205          * already in the tree.
00206          */
00207         interval_search(tree->rlt_root, &lock->rl_node.in_extent,
00208                         range_lock_cb, lock);
00209         /*
00210          * Insert to the tree if I am unique, otherwise I've been linked to
00211          * the rl_next_lock of another lock which has the same range as mine
00212          * in range_lock_cb().
00213          */
00214         node = interval_insert(&lock->rl_node, &tree->rlt_root);
00215         if (node != NULL) {
00216                 struct range_lock *tmp = node2rangelock(node);
00217 
00218                 list_add_tail(&lock->rl_next_lock, &tmp->rl_next_lock);
00219                 tmp->rl_lock_count++;
00220         }
00221         lock->rl_sequence = ++tree->rlt_sequence;
00222 
00223         while (lock->rl_blocking_ranges > 0) {
00224                 lock->rl_task = current;
00225                 __set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
00226                 spin_unlock(&tree->rlt_lock);
00227                 schedule();
00228 
00229                 if (signal_pending(current)) {
00230                         range_unlock(tree, lock);
00231                         GOTO(out, rc = -EINTR);
00232                 }
00233                 spin_lock(&tree->rlt_lock);
00234         }
00235         spin_unlock(&tree->rlt_lock);
00236 out:
00237         RETURN(rc);
00238 }
